channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Arson engulfs Mississippi synagogue, a congregation once bombed by Ku Klux Klan
item.description: A suspect is charged with arson in a fire that burned through a synagogue in Mississippi. Flames and smoke destroyed its library, housing Torahs.
item.content:encoded:
A suspect is charged with arson in a fire that burned through a synagogue in Mississippi. Flames and smoke destroyed its library, housing Torahs.

(Image credit: Hannah Orlansky)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: DHS restricts congressional visits to ICE facilities in Minneapolis with new policy
item.description: A memo from Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem, obtained by NPR, instructs her staff that visits should be requested at least seven days in advance.
item.content:encoded:
A memo from Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem, obtained by NPR, instructs her staff that visits should be requested at least seven days in advance.

(Image credit: Stephen Maturen)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: The latest in the fatal shooting of Renee Good by an ICE officer in Minneapolis
item.description: The latest developments from Minneapolis, where tension between residents and immigration agents is intensifying days after a deadly shooting by an ICE agent.
item.content:encoded: The latest developments from Minneapolis, where tension between residents and immigration agents is intensifying days after a deadly shooting by an ICE agent.
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Minnesota clergy are mobilizing against the fatal shooting of Renee Good
item.description: After the fatal shooting of Renee Good in Minneapolis by an ICE agent, area clergy are planning protests and other public demonstrations.
item.content:encoded: After the fatal shooting of Renee Good in Minneapolis by an ICE agent, area clergy are planning protests and other public demonstrations.
item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose

item.title: After Minnesota, Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine fights back against claims of child care fraud
item.description: Accusations of benefits fraud has spread from Minnesota to Ohio, where the Republican governor is trying to fight back with facts and tamp down finger-pointing at Somali-Americans.
item.content:encoded: Accusations of benefits fraud has spread from Minnesota to Ohio, where the Republican governor is trying to fight back with facts and tamp down finger-pointing at Somali-Americans.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Donaldson

item.title: Nationwide anti-ICE protests call for accountability after Renee Good's death
item.description: People in cities across the country demonstrated against the Trump administration's immigration enforcement tactics and the killing of Renee Good in Minneapolis.
item.content:encoded:
People in cities across the country demonstrated against the Trump administration's immigration enforcement tactics and the killing of Renee Good in Minneapolis.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Veteran actor T.K. Carter, known for 'The Thing' and 'Punky Brewster,' dies at 69
item.description: T.K. Carter gained fame as Nauls the cook in John Carpenter's 1982 horror classic, "The Thing."
item.content:encoded:
T.K. Carter gained fame as Nauls the cook in John Carpenter's 1982 horror classic, "The Thing."

(Image credit: Mary Altaffer)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: US launches new retaliatory strikes against ISIS in Syria after deadly ambush
item.description: The U.S. has launched another round of strikes against the Islamic State in Syria. This follows last month's ambush that killed two U.S. soldiers and an American civilian interpreter.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. has launched another round of strikes against the Islamic State in Syria. This follows last month's ambush that killed two U.S. soldiers and an American civilian interpreter.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: FDA commissioner explains new food pyramid, encourages greater uptake of core childhood vaccines
item.description: Martin Makary, commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration, on the push against ultra processed foods and added sugar, and what that could mean for school lunches and food labels, and says the administration's hierarchy of vaccines is meant to encourage childhood vaccine uptake.
item.content:encoded: Martin Makary, commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration, on the push against ultra processed foods and added sugar, and what that could mean for school lunches and food labels, and says the administration's hierarchy of vaccines is meant to encourage childhood vaccine uptake.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: 6 killed in Mississippi shooting rampage, authorities say
item.description: The alleged gunman, 24, has been charged with murder after the Friday shootings in northeast Mississippi. The victims include his father, uncle, brother and a 7-year-old relative, authorities said.
item.content:encoded: The alleged gunman, 24, has been charged with murder after the Friday shootings in northeast Mississippi. The victims include his father, uncle, brother and a 7-year-old relative, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise
